jd: Hello, Hope you are doing well! Please review the JD and share resumes. Job Description - Job Description - LinkedIn mandatory, Local candidates only no representation, Candidate must be within 30 miles area, Need only one strong profile only. AWS Developer Trenton, NJ, 5 Days On-Site Strong US experience Must Have: Cloud Application Development Required 7 Years Serverless Computing (AWS Lambda, etc.) Required 7 Years Microservices Architecture Required 5 Years Programming (Python, Java) Desired 5 Years API Development (RESTful) Required 7 Years AWS SDKs and CLI Required 7 Years AWS Services (S3, DynamoDB, API Gateway, File Transfer etc.) Required 7 Years Automation and Scripting Required 7 Years Security Best Practices Required 7 Years Problem-Solving Required 7 Years Testing (Unit, Integration) Required 7 Years AWS Solution Architect Certification Highly desired AWS Sysops Admin Certification Highly desired The AWS Developer will need experience designing, developing, & deploying cloud-native applications on AWS. As an AWS Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and deploying cloud-native applications on the AWS platform. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to build scalable and secure solutions that meet business requirements. The role requires strong knowledge of AWS services, server-less computing, and microservices architecture to build scalable, secure, and efficient applications that leverage the full potential of AWS services. You will play a key role in developing applications that are reliable, efficient, and optimized for performance in a cloud environment. Responsibilities: • Design and develop cloud-native applications using AWS services such as AWS Transfer Family, Glue, Lambda, VPC, DynamoDB, API Gateway, and S3. • Implement serverless architectures and microservices using AWS best practices. • Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code using programming languages such as Python, Node.js, or Java. • Develop and integrate RESTful APIs to support application functionality. • Collaborate with architects, engineers, and product managers to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions. • Utilize AWS SDKs and tools to integrate with various AWS services and automate workflows. • Ensure applications are secure, scalable, and optimized for performance. • Monitor and troubleshoot application performance and resolve issues as they arise. • Write unit and integration tests to ensure application quality and reliability. • Stay updated on AWS services and emerging cloud technologies to incorporate them into projects.
